Item ID21028

The dragon harpoon is a wieldable harpoon that requires 61 Fishing to use and 60 Attack to wield. The harpoon gives the player a 20% increased catch rate compared to the regular harpoon. Its combat stats are comparable to the Dragon dagger, but it is 1 tick slower.

Combat styles[edit | edit source]

Stab Sword
Combat OptionsCombat StyleStyle typeWeapon StyleExperienceInvisible Boost

A player performs the dragon harpoon's special attack, Fishstabber.

Special attack[edit | edit source]

The dragon harpoon has a special attack, Fishstabber, that provides a visible +3 boost to Fishing. This consumes 100% of the player's special attack energy. Special attacks require the player to wield the weapon, so this Fishing boost cannot be used without the 60 Attack required to wield the harpoon.

Upgrading[edit | edit source]

A player uses a smouldering stone to create an infernal harpoon.

Players can combine a smouldering stone with a dragon harpoon to create an infernal harpoon, requiring 75 Fishing and 85 Cooking (boosts not allowed) to do so. This process cannot be undone. The infernal harpoon will grant the player a 1/3 chance to cook the fish for half Cooking experience, destroying it (excluding Harpoonfish, which are not destroyed), whilst fishing. The infernal harpoon will be able to consume 5,000 fish before degrading, requiring another smouldering stone or dragon harpoon to charge it.

Players can also create a crystal harpoon via a singing bowl by combining a dragon harpoon, 120 crystal shards and a crystal tool seed. This requires level 76 Smithing and Crafting, which can be boosted. If players cannot create it on their own, they can have Conwenna or Reese sing the crystal for them for an extra 60 crystal shards, for a total of 180.

Item sources[edit | edit source]

The dragon harpoon is dropped at a rate of 1/2,000 if killed as part of a Slayer task.

For an exhaustive list of all known sources for this item, see here (include RDT).

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
14 April 2021
(update)

The Dragon Harpoon will now always consume 100% of the special attack power.

10 January 2019
(update | poll)

Following the release of Kebos Lowlands, dragon harpoon was moved from the Chambers of Xeric drop table to wyrms.

[[File:Dragon harpoon detail.png|left|75px]]
The '''dragon harpoon''' is a wieldable [[harpoon]] that requires 61 [[Fishing]] to use and 60 [[Attack]] to wield. The harpoon gives the player a 20% increased catch rate compared to the regular harpoon. Its combat stats are comparable to the [[Dragon dagger]], but it is 1 tick slower.

==Combat styles==
{{CombatStyles|Stab Sword}}
[[File:Fishstabber.gif|frame|A player performs the dragon harpoon's special attack, ''Fishstabber''.]]

==Special attack==
The dragon harpoon has a [[special attack]], ''Fishstabber'', that provides a visible +3 boost to [[Fishing]]. This consumes 100% of the player's special attack energy. Special attacks require the player to wield the weapon, so this Fishing boost cannot be used without the 60 Attack required to wield the harpoon.

==Products==
{{Uses material list|Dragon harpoon}}
==Upgrading==
[[File:Smouldering stone.gif|left|frame|A player uses a smouldering stone to create an infernal harpoon.]]
Players can combine a [[smouldering stone]] with a dragon harpoon to create an [[infernal harpoon]], requiring 75 Fishing and 85 [[Cooking]] (boosts not allowed) to do so. This process '''cannot''' be undone. The infernal harpoon will grant the player a 1/3 chance to cook the fish for half Cooking experience, destroying it (excluding [[Harpoonfish]], which are not destroyed), whilst fishing. The infernal harpoon will be able to consume 5,000 fish before degrading, requiring another [[smouldering stone]] or dragon harpoon to charge it.

Players can also create a [[crystal harpoon]] via a [[singing bowl]] by combining a dragon harpoon, 120 [[crystal shard]]s and a [[crystal tool seed]]. This requires level 76 [[Smithing]] and [[Crafting]], which can be [[Temporary skill boost|boosted]]. If players cannot create it on their own, they can have [[Conwenna]] or [[Reese]] sing the crystal for them for an extra 60 crystal shards, for a total of 180.
